test-set.name: op-concat
test-set.description: Tests for the "||" concatenation operator (new in XPath 3.0). Tests adapted from the fn:concat() tests by Michael Kay

test-case.name: op-concatint2args-1
test-case.description: ******************************************************* Test: concatint2args-1 Written By: Carmelo Montanez Date: Wed Dec 15 15:41:48 GMT-05:00 2004 Purpose: Evaluates The "concat" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg1 = xs:int(lower bound) $arg2 = xs:int(lower bound) *******************************************************

test-case.description: ******************************************************* Test: concatint2args-2 Written By: Carmelo Montanez Date: Wed Dec 15 15:41:48 GMT-05:00 2004 Purpose: Evaluates The "concat" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg1 = xs:int(mid range) $arg2 = xs:int(lower bound) *******************************************************

test-case.name: op-concat-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 1 (for this function) from the F&O specs.

test-case.name: op-concat-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 2 (for this function) from the F&O specs.
test-case.test: ('Thy ' || () || 'old ' || "groans" || "" || ' ring' || ' yet' || ' in' || ' my' || ' ancient' || ' ears.')

result.assert-string-value: Thy old groans ring yet in my ancient ears.

test-case.name: op-concat-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 3 (for this function) from the F&O specs.

test-case.name: op-concat-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 4 (for this function) from the F&O specs.

test-case.name: op-concat-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses only upper case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: op-concat-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses only lower case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: op-concat-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses both upper and lower case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: op-concat-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses the empty string as part of argument Uses "fn:count" to avoid the empty file

test-case.name: op-concat-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses the "upper-case" function as part of argument

test-case.name: op-concat-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument set to "*****"

test-case.name: op-concat-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument that uses another concat function

test-case.name: op-concat-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as an argument to the "fn:boolean" function

test-case.name: op-concat-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as an argument to the "fn:string" function

test-case.name: op-concat-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as an argument to the "fn:not" function

test-case.name: op-concat-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument set to "%$" || #@!"

test-case.name: op-concat-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument set to "concat" || "concat"

test-case.name: op-concat-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as part of a boolean expression

test-case.name: op-concat-18
test-case.description: Can't have a function item as an argument to concat

test-case.name: op-concat-19
test-case.description: Concat operator has lower precedence than plus/minus

test-case.name: op-concat-20
test-case.description: Concat operator has higher precedence than eq

test-case.name: K-ConcatOp-3
test-case.description: Purpose: A test whose essence is: `("ab" || "c") eq "abc"`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatOp-4
test-case.description: Purpose: A test whose essence is: `concat("ab" || "c") instance of xs:string`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatOp-5
test-case.description: Purpose: A test whose essence is: `concat(() || ()) instance of xs:string`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatOp-6
test-case.description: Purpose: A test whose essence is: `concat(() || ()) eq ""`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatOp-7
test-case.description: Purpose: A test whose essence is: `('a' || 'b' || 'c' || () || 'd' || 'e' || 'f' || 'g' || 'h' || ' ' || 'i' || 'j' || 'k l') eq "abcdefgh ijk l"`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatOp-8
test-case.description: Purpose: A test whose essence is: `(1 || 2 || 3) eq "123"`.
